title: Drawing, "Study: Peony Stalk with Blossoms", early 20th century
medium: Brush and gouache on gray paper
inscribed: recto: S. L. Crownfield (inscribed by her sister, Gertrude) / No. 24
creditline: Gift of Starling W. Childs and Ward Cheney
description: Vertical sheet illustrating a peony stalk drawn to left center of sheet.  The stalk contains two blossoms - one fully opened, the other only partially - in shades of pinks and yellow.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Study: Peony Stalk with Blossoms", early 20th century.
early 20th century. Brush and gouache on gray paper. Gift of Starling W. Childs and Ward Cheney. 1937-59-23.
